Traditionally, natural language processing (NLP) models often use a rich set of features created by linguistic expertise, such as semantic representations. However, in the era of large language models (LLMs), more and more tasks are turned into generic, end-to-end sequence generation problems. In this paper, we investigate the question: what is the role of semantic representations in the era of LLMs? Specifically, we investigate the effect of Abstract Meaning Representation (AMR) across five diverse NLP tasks. We propose an AMR-driven chain-of-thought prompting method, which we call AMRCoT, and find that it generally hurts performance more than it helps. To investigate what AMR may have to offer on these tasks, we conduct a series of analysis experiments. We find that it is difficult to predict which input examples AMR may help or hurt on, but errors tend to arise with multi-word expressions, named entities, and in the final inference step where the LLM must connect its reasoning over the AMR to its prediction. We recommend focusing on these areas for future work in semantic representations for LLMs. Our code: https://github.com/causalNLP/amr_llm.assistant
label: 传统上，自然语言处理（NLP）模型往往依赖于语言学专家创建的丰富特征集，例如语义表征。然而，在大型语言模型（LLM）的时代，越来越多的任务转变为通用的端到端序列生成问题。本文探讨了一个问题：在LLM时代，语义表征的作用是什么？具体而言，我们研究了抽象意义表示（AMR）在五种不同NLP任务中的效果。我们提出了一种基于AMR的思维链提示方法，称为AMRCoT，发现它通常对性能的负面影响大于积极作用。为了探索AMR在这些任务上可能带来的益处，我们进行了一系列分析实验。我们发现很难预测哪些输入示例会受AMR的帮助或损害，但错误往往出现在多词表达、命名实体以及LLM必须将其在AMR上的推理与预测联系起来的最终推理步骤中。我们建议未来在LLM的语义表征工作中重点关注这些领域。我们的代码：https://github.com/causalNLP/amr_llm.

The current state-of-the-art theoretical analysis of Actor-Critic (AC) algorithms significantly lags in addressing the practical aspects of AC implementations. This crucial gap needs bridging to bring the analysis in line with practical implementations of AC. To address this, we advocate for considering the MMCLG criteria: Multi-layer neural network parametrization for actor/critic, Markovian sampling, Continuous state-action spaces, the performance of the Last iterate, and Global optimality. These aspects are practically significant and have been largely overlooked in existing theoretical analyses of AC algorithms. In this work, we address these gaps by providing the first comprehensive theoretical analysis of AC algorithms that encompasses all five crucial practical aspects (covers MMCLG criteria). We establish global convergence sample complexity bounds of $\tilde{\mathcal{O}}\left({\epsilon^{-3}}\right)$. We achieve this result through our novel use of the weak gradient domination property of MDP's and our unique analysis of the error in critic estimation.assistant

Large Vision-Language models (VLMs) have demonstrated strong reasoning capabilities in tasks requiring a fine-grained understanding of literal images and text, such as visual question-answering or visual entailment. However, there has been little exploration of these models' capabilities when presented with images and captions containing figurative phenomena such as metaphors or humor, the meaning of which is often implicit. To close this gap, we propose a new task and a high-quality dataset: Visual Figurative Language Understanding with Textual Explanations (V-FLUTE). We frame the visual figurative language understanding problem as an explainable visual entailment task, where the model has to predict whether the image (premise) entails a claim (hypothesis) and justify the predicted label with a textual explanation. Using a human-AI collaboration framework, we build a high-quality dataset, V-FLUTE, that contains 6,027 <image, claim, label, explanation> instances spanning five diverse multimodal figurative phenomena: metaphors, similes, idioms, sarcasm, and humor. The figurative phenomena can be present either in the image, the caption, or both. We further conduct both automatic and human evaluations to assess current VLMs' capabilities in understanding figurative phenomena.assistant

The Disk II single-sided floppy drive used 5.25-inch floppy disks; double-sided disks could be used, one side at a time, by turning them over and notching a hole for the write protect sensor. The first disk operating systems for the were and DOS 3.2, which stored 113.75 KB on each disk, organized into 35 tracks of 13 256-byte sectors each. After about two years, DOS 3.3 was introduced, storing 140 KB thanks to a minor firmware change on the disk controller that allowed it to store 16 sectors per track. (This upgrade was user-installable as two PROMs on older controllers.) After the release of DOS 3.3, the user community discontinued use of except for running legacy software. Programs that required DOS 3.2 were fairly rare; however, as DOS 3.3 was not a major architectural change aside from the number of sectors per track, a program called MUFFIN was provided with DOS 3.3 to allow users to copy files from DOS 3.2 disks to DOS 3.3 disks. It was possible for software developers to create a DOS 3.2 disk which would also boot on a system with firmware.assistant

Distinguished from traditional knowledge graphs (KGs), temporal knowledge graphs (TKGs) must explore and reason over temporally evolving facts adequately. However, existing TKG approaches still face two main challenges, i.e., the limited capability to model arbitrary timestamps continuously and the lack of rich inference patterns under temporal constraints. In this paper, we propose an innovative TKGE method (PTBox) via polynomial decomposition-based temporal representation and box embedding-based entity representation to tackle the above-mentioned problems. Specifically, we decompose time information by polynomials and then enhance the model's capability to represent arbitrary timestamps flexibly by incorporating the learnable temporal basis tensor. In addition, we model every entity as a hyperrectangle box and define each relation as a transformation on the head and tail entity boxes. The entity boxes can capture complex geometric structures and learn robust representations, improving the model's inductive capability for rich inference patterns. Theoretically, our PTBox can encode arbitrary time information or even unseen timestamps while capturing rich inference patterns and higher-arity relations of the knowledge base. Extensive experiments on real-world datasets demonstrate the effectiveness of our method.assistant
label: 与传统知识图谱不同，时间知识图谱（TKG）需要充分探索和推理随时间演变的事实。然而，现有的TKG方法仍面临两大挑战：一是难以持续准确模拟任意时间戳，二是在时间约束下缺乏丰富的推理模式。在本论文中，我们提出了一种创新的TKGE方法（PTBox），通过多项式分解进行时间表征和基于盒模型的实体表征来解决这些问题。具体来说，我们将时间信息通过多项式进行分解，并通过整合可学习的时间基础张量，增强模型对任意时间戳的灵活表征能力。此外，我们将每个实体表示为一个超矩形盒，并定义每种关系为对头尾实体盒的转换操作。通过这种方式，实体盒不仅能捕捉复杂的几何结构，还能学习到稳健的表示，从而增强模型对丰富推理模式的归纳能力。理论上，我们的PTBox能够编码任意时间信息甚至未知时间戳，同时捕捉丰富的推理模式和更高阶的知识库关系。在多个真实世界数据集上的广泛实验已证明了我们方法的有效性。

The earliest people who could be described as "lawyers" were probably the orators of ancient Athens. However, Athenian orators faced serious structural obstacles. First, there was a rule that individuals were supposed to plead their own cases, which was soon bypassed by the increasing tendency of individuals to ask a "friend" for assistance. However, around the middle of the fourth century, the Athenians disposed of the perfunctory request for a friend. Second, a more serious obstacle, which the Athenian orators never completely overcame, was the rule that no one could take a fee to plead the cause of another. This law was widely disregarded in practice, but was never abolished, which meant that orators could "never" present themselves as legal professionals or experts. They had to uphold the legal fiction that they were merely an ordinary citizen generously helping out a friend for free, and thus they could never organize into a real profession. If one narrows the definition of lawyers to people who could practice the legal profession openly and legally, then the first lawyers would be the orators of ancient Rome.assistant

You are an expert translator and only output the result. Translate this from English to Chinese:
Two major areas of interest in the era of Large Language Models regard questions of what do LLMs know, and if and how they may be able to reason (or rather, approximately reason). Since to date these lines of work progressed largely in parallel (with notable exceptions), we are interested in investigating the intersection: probing for reasoning about the implicitly-held knowledge. Suspecting the performance to be lacking in this area, we use a very simple set-up of comparisons between cardinalities associated with elements of various subjects (e.g. the number of legs a bird has versus the number of wheels on a tricycle). We empirically demonstrate that although LLMs make steady progress in knowledge acquisition and (pseudo)reasoning with each new GPT release, their capabilities are limited to statistical inference only. It is difficult to argue that pure statistical learning can cope with the combinatorial explosion inherent in many commonsense reasoning tasks, especially once arithmetical notions are involved. Further, we argue that bigger is not always better and chasing purely statistical improvements is flawed at the core, since it only exacerbates the dangerous conflation of the production of correct answers with genuine reasoning ability.assistant
label: 在大型语言模型时代，有两个重要研究领域：LLMs所掌握的知识内容，以及它们是否能以及如何进行推理（或更准确地说，进行近似推理）。迄今为止，这些研究方向大多是并行发展的（尽管有一些值得注意的例外），因此我们特别关注于探索它们的交集：即对隐性知识进行推理的探针式研究。我们怀疑在这一领域的表现可能有所不足，因此采用了一个非常简单的比较方法，比较不同主题元素的基数（比如，鸟的腿数与三轮车的轮子数）。我们的实证研究表明，尽管每一次新的GPT版本发布都使LLMs在知识获取和（伪）推理方面稳步进步，但它们的能力仍仅限于统计推理。很难认为纯粹的统计学习足以应对许多常识推理任务中的组合爆炸问题，特别是涉及到算术概念时尤为如此。此外，我们认为更大不一定更好，仅追求统计学上的改进本质上是有缺陷的，因为这种做法只会进一步加剧正确答案产出与真正推理能力之间的危险混淆。
predict: 在大型语言模型时代，人们对 LLM 知识的理解以及 LLM 能否进行推理（或近似推理）等问题十分关注。迄今为止，关于这两方面的研究进展大多是分开进行的（有几个例外），因此我们很感兴趣探究这两方面的交集：通过探测来推理隐含知识。由于我们认为在这一领域的性能表现还不够理想，我们采用了比较简单的比较方案来比较各个领域的元素之间的基数（例如鸟类的腿数量与三轮车的轮子数量）。我们从实践的角度证明了尽管随着每个新 GPT 的发布，LLM 在知识获取和（伪）推理方面的进步都很稳定，但它们的能力仅限于统计推理。很难说纯粹的统计学习能否解决许多通用推理任务中固有的组合爆炸问题，尤其是涉及算术概念的时候。进一步，我们认为更大并不一定就是更好，纯粹的统计改进是错误的，因为它只会加剧生产正确答案和真正推理能力的危险混淆。

Collaborative robots must effectively communicate their internal state to humans to enable a smooth interaction. Nonverbal communication is widely used to communicate information during human-robot interaction, however, such methods may also be misunderstood, leading to communication errors. In this work, we explore modulating the acoustic parameter values (pitch bend, beats per minute, beats per loop) of nonverbal auditory expressions to convey functional robot states (accomplished, progressing, stuck). We propose a reinforcement learning (RL) algorithm based on noisy human feedback to produce accurately interpreted nonverbal auditory expressions. The proposed approach was evaluated through a user study with 24 participants. The results demonstrate that: 1. Our proposed RL-based approach is able to learn suitable acoustic parameter values which improve the users' ability to correctly identify the state of the robot. 2. Algorithm initialization informed by previous user data can be used to significantly speed up the learning process. 3. The method used for algorithm initialization strongly influences whether participants converge to similar sounds for each robot state. 4. Modulation of pitch bend has the largest influence on user association between sounds and robotic states.assistant
label: 协作机器人必须有效地向人类传递其内部状态，以确保互动顺畅。在人机交互中，非语言沟通被广泛用来传达信息，然而这种方式也容易被误解，从而导致沟通错误。在本研究中，我们探讨了调整非语言听觉表达中的声学参数值（音调弯曲、每分钟节拍数、每循环节拍数）以表达机器人的运行状态（完成、进行中、卡顿）。我们提出了一种基于带噪声的人类反馈的强化学习算法，用于生成容易被准确理解的非语言听觉表达。我们通过一项涉及24名参与者的用户研究来评估这种方法。研究结果显示：1. 我们的基于RL的方法能学习到合适的声学参数值，有助于用户正确判断机器人的状态。2. 利用历史用户数据进行算法初始化可以显著加快学习速度。3. 算法初始化的方式极大影响参与者是否可针对每种机器人状态产生相似的声音响应。4. 音调弯曲的调整对于用户将声音与机器人状态关联起来的影响是最显著的。

Webshell, as the "culprit" behind numerous network attacks, is one of the research hotspots in the field of cybersecurity. However, the complexity, stealthiness, and confusing nature of webshells pose significant challenges to the corresponding detection schemes. With the rise of Artificial Intelligence (AI) technology, researchers have started to apply different intelligent algorithms and neural network architectures to the task of webshell detection. However, the related research still lacks a systematic and standardized methodological process, which is confusing and redundant. Therefore, following the development timeline, we carefully summarize the progress of relevant research in this field, dividing it into three stages: Start Stage, Initial Development Stage, and In-depth Development Stage. We further elaborate on the main characteristics and core algorithms of each stage. In addition, we analyze the pain points and challenges that still exist in this field and predict the future development trend of this field from our point of view. To the best of our knowledge, this is the first review that details the research related to AI-based webshell detection. It is also hoped that this paper can provide detailed technical information for more researchers interested in AI-based webshell detection tasks.assistant
label: Webshell作为诸多网络攻击背后的“罪魁祸首”，已成为网络安全研究领域的热点之一。然而，Webshell的复杂、隐蔽和令人迷惑的特性给相应的检测方案带来了极大的挑战。随着人工智能（AI）技术的兴起，研究者们已开始采用各种智能算法和神经网络结构来进行Webshell检测。尽管如此，相关研究尚缺乏一种系统化且标准化的研究方法，这使得研究过程既令人困惑又重复。因此，我们根据发展时间线精心总结了该领域的研究进展，并将其划分为三个阶段：起始阶段、初步发展阶段和深入发展阶段。我们进一步详细讨论了每个阶段的主要特性和核心算法。此外，我们还分析了当前该领域面临的主要痛点和挑战，并从我们的视角预测了该领域的未来发展趋势。据我们所知，本文是首篇详尽综述AI技术在Webshell检测领域应用的研究。我们希望本文能为广大研究人员提供对基于AI的Webshell检测任务的深入技术资讯。
predict: 网络后门作为多种网络攻击背后的“罪魁祸首”，在网络安全领域中一直是研究的热点之一，但是网络后门的复杂性、隐蔽性以及对称性给相关检测方案带来了巨大的挑战。随着人工智能技术的崛起，研究者们开始将不同的智能算法和神经网络架构应用到网络后门检测任务中来，但是相关研究还缺乏系统化和规范化的方法论过程，存在着冗余和混乱。因此，我们严格按照发展时间线对该领域相关研究进行了细致的总结，将其分为三个阶段：起步阶段、初步发展阶段和深入发展阶段，并对各个阶段的主要特点和核心算法进行了详细阐述。此外，我们分析了该领域目前还存在的痛点和挑战，并从我们自己的角度预测了该领域的未来发展趋势。据我们所知，这是第一篇详细阐述人工智能技术在网络后门检测任务中的应用研究的综述文章，也希望这篇文章能够为更多对人工智能技术在网络后门检测任务中的应用感兴趣的研究者提供详细的技术信息。
